tags: snape was a good man who done bad things
summary: Why do people forgive 17yr old  Draco  for saying mudblood, many many times during the book and never feeling bad or sorry for...
body:
Why do people forgive 17yr old  Draco for saying mudblood, many many times during the book and never feeling bad or sorry for it. He loved saying it.

But won’t forgive 15 yr old Snape for saying it once “during his humiliation and his fury” and felt immediately sorry and never used it again and shouted at Phineas Nigellus for saying it and told him not to use that word.

If they can forgive Draco then they should forgive Snape for using the word mudblood.

The double standards of the fandom amazes me.

you wear a different face to each atrocity.
you are un-unified and tangled.

summary: So I don't know who else noticed this, but it is literally impossible for Credence to be Albus' brother. Percival Dumbledore...
body: So I don’t know who else noticed this, but it is literally impossible for Credence to be Albus’ brother. Percival Dumbledore died in 1890 in Azkaban, and Kendra Dumbledore died in 1899 when Ariana had a fit. Credence wasn’t born until 1901.

reblog.comment: So I don’t know who else noticed this, but it is literally impossible for Credence to be Albus’ brother. Percival Dumbledore died in 1890 in Azkaban, and Kendra Dumbledore died in 1899 when Ariana had a fit. Credence wasn’t born until 1901.

trail.content_raw: So I don’t know who else noticed this, but it is literally impossible for Credence to be Albus’ brother. Percival Dumbledore died in 1890 in Azkaban, and Kendra Dumbledore died in 1899 when Ariana had a fit. Credence wasn’t born until 1901.
trail.content: So I don’t know who else noticed this, but it is literally impossible for Credence to be Albus’ brother. Percival Dumbledore died in 1890 in Azkaban, and Kendra Dumbledore died in 1899 when Ariana had a fit. Credence wasn’t born until 1901.

blog.name: savvicc666
blog.title: [Tea Spilt Here]
blog.description: This is all just a mixture of obsessions and nonsense, enjoy.

summary: Did it piss anyone else off in the Harry Potter & The Deathly Hallows when everything about Grindelwald is blatantly ignored??? ...
body:
Did it piss anyone else off in the Harry Potter & The Deathly Hallows when everything about Grindelwald is blatantly ignored??? He’s mentioned as Albus’ friend & Bathilda Bagshot’s Great-Nephew, the information that is given on him is that he stole the Elder Wand from Gregorovitch & that (un-truthfully) he told Voldemort the whereabouts of the Elder Wand.

–The Potter series simply has a thing for making characters un-redeemable instead of sticking to what was written.

blog.name: savvicc666

blog.description: This is all just a mixture of obsessions and nonsense, enjoy.

summary: Honestly, I cannot wait to see the battle between Dumbledore and Grindelwald. The whole thing makes me emotional; Dumbledore...
body: Honestly, I cannot wait to see the battle between Dumbledore and Grindelwald. The whole thing makes me emotional; Dumbledore puts off fighting Grindelwald for a whole 18(+) years, he’s finally doing it and Grindelwald (I assume not too far into the battle) just gives up and goes with him willingly… He allows himself to be locked up in his own prison for 52 years before he gets killed by Voldemort because he won’t tell him where the Elder Wand is.

reblog.comment: Honestly, I cannot wait to see the battle between Dumbledore and Grindelwald. The whole thing makes me emotional; Dumbledore puts off fighting Grindelwald for a whole 18(+) years, he’s finally doing it and Grindelwald (I assume not too far into the battle) just gives up and goes with him willingly… He allows himself to be locked up in his own prison for 52 years before he gets killed by Voldemort because he won’t tell him where the Elder Wand is.

The whole thing makes me emotional; Dumbledore puts off fighting Grindelwald for a whole 18(+) years, he’s finally doing it and Grindelwald (I assume not too far into the battle) just gives up and goes with him willingly… He allows himself to be locked up in his own prison for 52 years before he gets killed by Voldemort because he won’t tell him where the Elder Wand is.
trail.content: Honestly, I cannot wait to see the battle between Dumbledore and Grindelwald. The whole thing makes me emotional; Dumbledore puts off fighting Grindelwald for a whole 18(+) years, he’s finally doing it and Grindelwald (I assume not too far into the battle) just gives up and goes with him willingly… He allows himself to be locked up in his own prison for 52 years before he gets killed by Voldemort because he won’t tell him where the Elder Wand is.

summary: Happy holidays! Some siat darry perhaps?
question: Happy holidays! Some siat darry perhaps?
answer:
Draco doesn’t really consider his body to be a sexual object. It’s a canvas, and he’s art. He dresses like he does and grows his hair out and smiles just so because he likes when people are looking at him. He’s not even the artist, half the time he just does what Pansy tells him to, he’s the art piece, which is how he likes it. 

However. 

He gets a thrill up his spine when Harry’s eyes darken, when he can’t keep his hands off him, when Harry’s trying to to tug his too tight pants over his hipbones and can’t quite manage it. 

Harry likes him best in nothing at all, likes him as a blank canvas, and Draco feels most beautiful when Harry is looking at him, hands intertwined.
